item.name: Spider Root
entries: A paste made by mashing the fine, threadlike roots of a certain creeper vine, spider root renders a victim {@condition clumsy} and maladroit.

item.name: Spike Snare
entries: This basic snare consists of {@condition hidden} spikes that rely on a creature's momentum to lacerate or potentially impale it as it enters the snare's square, dealing {@damage 2d8} piercing damage. The creature must attempt a DC 17 basic Reflex saving throw.

item.name: Spined Shield
entries: Five jagged spines project from the surface of this steel shield (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12). The spines are +1 striking shield spikes. When you use the {@feat Shield Block} reaction with this shield, the spines take the damage before the shield itself does. When the shield would take damage (after applying Hardness), one spine snaps off per 6 damage, reducing the damage by 6. The shield takes any remaining damage. When there are no spines left, the shield takes damage as normal.
When all the spines are gone, you lose the ability to attack with them until the spines regenerate the next day.
You shoot one of the shield's spines at a target. A fired spine uses the spikes' statistics, but it is a martial ranged weapon with a range increment of 120 feet.

item.name: Spyglass
entries: A typical spyglass lets you see eight times farther than normal.
A fine spyglass adds a +1 item bonus to {@skill Perception} checks to notice details at a distance.

item.name: Staff of Abjuration
entries: This intricately carved wooden staff is warm to the touch and thrums with inner energy. While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify abjuration magic.
You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craftReq: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

items: {@bold 2nd} dispel magic, endure elements, resist energy
{@bold 4th} dimensional anchor, dispel magic, resist energy

item.name: Staff of Conjuration
entries: This ash staff is decorated with animals; wielding it, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify conjuration magic.
You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craftReq: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

items: {@bold 2nd} obscuring mist, phantom steed, summon construct, summon elemental
{@bold 3rd} stinking cloud, summon construct, summon elemental
{@bold 4th} creation, phantom steed, summon construct, summon elemental
{@bold 5th} black tentacles, summon construct, summon elemental
{@bold 6th} phantom steed, summon construct, summon elemental

item.name: Staff of Divination
entries: Semiprecious gemstones emerge, seemingly at random, from the surface of this gnarled wooden staff. While wielding it, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify divination magic.
You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craftReq: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff of Enchantment
entries: A mesmerizing gemstone caps the head of this handsomely crafted wooden staff. While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify enchantment magic.
You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craftReq: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff of Evocation
entries: This staff is tapered at the base and carved into a gemstudded twist at the top. While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify evocation magic.
You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craftReq: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff of Fire
entries: This staff resembles a blackened and burned length of ashen wood. It smells faintly of soot and glows as if lit by embers.
You can use an {@action Interact} action to touch the tip of this staff to a torch, tinder, or a flammable substance to ignite a flame.
You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craftReq: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

items: {@bold 4th} fire shield, fireball, wall of fire

item.name: Staff of Healing
entries: Made of smooth, white wood, this staff is capped at each end with a golden cross adorned with a multitude of ruby cabochons. A staff of healing grants an item bonus to the Hit Points you restore anytime you cast the {@spell heal} spell using your own spell slots or using charges from the staff.
You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craftReq: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

entries: The item bonus granted to {@spell heal} spells is +1.
The item bonus granted to {@spell heal} spells is +2.
The item bonus granted to {@spell heal} spells is +3.

items: {@bold 5th} breath of life, heal, remove disease

entries: The item bonus granted to {@spell heal} spells is +4.

item.name: Staff of Illumination
entries: This simple iron staff is capped with a faceted, clear gem.
The gem at the top of the staff glows as a torch, shedding bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 20 feet) for 10 minutes.
You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craftReq: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff of Illusion
entries: This ornately designed metal staff shines with precious inlays of gold. When you {@action Cast a Spell} from the staff, the illusory image of something you desire flashes across its surface.
While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify illusion magic.
You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craftReq: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff of Necromancy
entries: This twisted and grim-looking staff is adorned with hideous skull and bone motifs. While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify necromancy magic.
You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craftReq: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff of Power
entries: This staff of magically hardened wood is topped with a silver sculpture depicting magical runic symbols. When used as a weapon, a staff of power is a +2 greater striking staff.

Voluntarily destroying a staff of power unleashes an incredible blast of energy. When wielding the staff, you can {@action Interact} to break it. This releases a 30-foot-burst magical explosion centered on the staff. This deals {@damage 2d8} force damage per charge remaining in the staff (DC 40 basic Reflex save)
You automatically critically fail your save. A creature reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage dies instantly; this is a {@trait death} effect.
You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

items: {@bold 7th} cone of cold, fireball, lightning bolt

item.craftReq: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff of the Magi
entries: Sigils and runes of ancient and powerful magic cover the iron cladding on this long wooden staff. A staff of the magi is a +3 major striking staff, and when wielding it you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against spells.

Voluntarily destroying a staff of the magi unleashes a truly devastating wave of arcane energy that surges out, dissipating with distance. When wielding the staff, you can break it using an {@action Interact} action. This releases a 30-foot-burst magical explosion centered on the staff. This deals {@damage 2d10} force damage per charge remaining in the staff (DC 40 basic Reflex save), You automatically critically fail your save. The explosion continues to echo beyond the initial blast zone, dealing half as much damage to creatures beyond 30 feet but within a 60-foot burst. A creature reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage dies instantly; this is a {@trait death} effect.
You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

items: {@bold Cantrip} detect magic, light, mage hand, telekinetic projectile
{@bold 2nd} enlarge, glitterdust, invisibility, knock, telekinetic maneuver, web
{@bold 4th} invisibility, enlarge, fireball, wall of fire, web
{@bold 5th} cone of cold, passwall, telekinetic haul
{@bold 6th} disintegrate, dispel magic, fireball, lightning bolt
{@bold 7th} cone of cold, passwall, plane shift, wall of fire
{@bold 9th} dispel magic, meteor swarm, summon dragon

item.craftReq: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff of Transmutation
entries: A glass orb atop this metal staff contains fine, undulating sand.
While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify transmutation magic.
You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craftReq: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

items: {@bold 6th} baleful polymorph, dragon form, flesh to stone

item.name: Stalker Bane Snare
entries: This snare explodes in a burst of cloying powder that can cling to a creature stepping into its square. A creature that enters the square of a stalker bane snare must attempt a DC 20 Reflex save.

entries.Success: Powder sticks to the target, causing it to leave behind telltale footprints. Being {@condition invisible} makes the target {@condition hidden}, rather than {@condition undetected}, to creatures that could see it if it weren't {@condition invisible}.
entries.Failure: Powder clumps on the target, constantly flaking away. Being {@condition invisible} makes the target {@condition concealed}, rather than {@condition hidden} or {@condition undetected}, to creatures that could see it if it weren't {@condition invisible}.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, and the creature is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Stone Bullet
entries: This sling bullet looks like a {@condition petrified} serpent's eye. A creature hit by an activated stone bullet is subject to the effects of a 6th-level {@spell flesh to stone} spell (DC 34).
item.craftReq: Supply one casting of flesh to stone.

item.name: Stone Fist Elixir
entries: Your fists become hard as stone. For 1 hour, your fists deal {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and lose the {@trait nonlethal} trait.

item.name: Storm Arrow
entries: The head of this arrow is made from gleaming copper.

When an activated storm arrow hits a target, it is buffeted by raging winds and struck by a bolt of lightning that deals {@damage 3d12} electricity damage and the target must attempt a DC 25 Reflex saving throw. If this arrow is shot from a weapon with a shock property rune, the save DC increases to 27, though the attack doesn't benefit from the shock property rune itself.

entries.Success: The foe takes half damage and isn't affected by the wind.
entries.Failure: The foe takes full damage and is buffeted by winds for 1 round, taking a –2 circumstance penalty to ranged attack rolls and a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its fly Speed.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the foe takes double damage.

item.name: Storm Flash
entries: This +2 greater striking shock rapier has a golden blade, and miniature electric arcs flash across its guard while it's wielded. When out of its sheath under an open sky, the blade causes storm clouds to gather slowly above.
You cast a 6th-level {@spell lightning bolt} (DC 33).

entries.trigger: An {@trait electricity} effect targets you or a creature within 10 feet of you, or has you or a creature within 10 feet of you in its area
entries: You try to divert the electricity off course, to be absorbed by storm flash. Choose one eligible creature to protect and roll a melee attack roll against the DC of the {@trait electricity} effect. If you succeed, the chosen creature takes no electricity damage from the triggering effect.
This is a +3 greater striking greater shock rapier. When activating the sword to cast {@spell lightning bolt}, the spell is 8th level (DC 38).

item.name: Striking
entries: A striking rune stores destructive magic in the weapon, increasing the weapon damage dice it deals to two instead of one. For instance, a +1 striking dagger would deal {@dice 2d4} damage instead of {@dice 1d4} damage.

You can upgrade the striking rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.
The weapon deals three weapon damage dice.
The weapon deals four weapon damage dice.

item.name: Striking Snare
entries: You affix a trip line or other trigger to a group of either stones or wooden stakes to strike a creature that enters the snare's square. The creature must attempt a DC 26 basic Reflex saving throw. If you choose stones, the snare deals {@damage 9d8} bludgeoning damage; if you choose spikes, it deals {@damage 9d8} piercing damage.

item.name: Stunning Snare
entries: You rig a snare to disorient a creature with a quick bash, leaving it with little ability to defend itself. The trap deals {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage to the first creature to enter its square; that creature must attempt a DC 31 Reflex save.

entries.Success: The creature takes half damage and is {@condition flat-footed} for 1 round and {@condition stunned 1}.
entries.Failure: The creature takes full damage and is {@condition flat-footed} for 1 round and {@condition stunned 2}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature takes double damage and is {@condition flat-footed} for 1 minute and {@condition stunned 4}.

item.name: Sturdy Shield
entries: With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.
The shield has Hardness 8, HP 64, and BT 32.
The shield has Hardness 10, HP 80, and BT 40.
The shield has Hardness 13, HP 104, and BT 52.
The shield has Hardness 15, HP 120, and BT 60.
The shield has Hardness 17, HP 136, and BT 68.
The shield has Hardness 20, HP 160, and BT 80.

item.name: Sunrod
entries: This 1-foot-long, gold-tipped rod glows after it's struck on a hard surface. For the next 6 hours, it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 40 feet).

item.name: Survey Map
entries: Maps are uncommon. Most maps you can find are simple and functional. A survey map details a single location in excellent detail. One of these maps gives you a +1 item bonus to {@skill Survival} checks and any skill checks to {@action Recall Knowledge}, provided the checks are related to the location detailed on the map. The GM determines what maps are available in any location.
Maps sometimes come in atlases, containing a number of maps of the same quality, often on similar topics. An atlas costs five times as much as a single map and requires both hands to use.

item.name: Swift Block Cabochon

activate.trigger: You take damage from a physical attack while you don't have the affixed shield raised.

entries: This clear quartz cabochon attaches to the center of your shield. When you activate the cabochon, you use the {@feat Shield Block} reaction even if you hadn't raised the affixed shield (and even if you don't normally have that reaction).

item.name: Tack
entries: Tack includes all the gear required to outfit a riding animal, including a saddle, bit and bridle, and stirrups if necessary. Especially large or oddly shaped animals might require specialty saddles. These can be more expensive or hard to find, as determined by the GM. The Bulk value given is for tack worn by a creature. If carried, the Bulk increases to 2.

item.name: Tanglefoot Bag
entries: A tanglefoot bag is filled with sticky substances.
When you hit a creature with a tanglefoot bag, that creature takes a status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute.
Many types of tanglefoot bag also grant an item bonus on attack rolls.

On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and {@condition immobilized} for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to {@action Fly} again for 1 round. Tanglefoot bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water.

The target can end any effects by {@action Escape||Escaping} or spending a total of 3 {@action Interact} actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These {@action Interact} actions don't have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well.
The target takes a –10-foot penalty, and the {@action Escape} DC is 17.

entries.with: a –10-foot penalty
{@action Escape||Escaping} ({@action Escape} DC 17)

entries.replace: Many types of tanglefoot bag also grant an item bonus on attack rolls.

entries: You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls, the target takes a –15-foot penalty, and the {@action Escape} DC is 19.

entries.with: a –15-foot penalty
{@action Escape||Escaping} ({@action Escape} DC 19)

entries.replace: Many types of tanglefoot bag also grant an item bonus on attack rolls.
entries.with: You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

entries: You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls, the target takes a –15-foot penalty, and the {@action Escape} DC is 28.

entries.with: a –15-foot penalty
{@action Escape||Escaping} ({@action Escape} DC 28)

entries.replace: Many types of tanglefoot bag also grant an item bonus on attack rolls.
entries.with: You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls.

entries: You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls, the target takes a –20-foot penalty, and the {@action Escape} DC is 37.

entries.with: a –20-foot penalty
{@action Escape||Escaping} ({@action Escape} DC 37)

entries.replace: Many types of tanglefoot bag also grant an item bonus on attack rolls.
entries.with: You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls.

item.name: Tears of Death
entries: Tears of death are among the most powerful of alchemical poisons, distilled from extracts of five other deadly poisons in just the right ratios.

item.name: Ten-Foot Pole
entries: When wielding this long pole, you can use {@action Seek} to search a square up to 10 feet away. The pole is not sturdy enough to use as a weapon.

item.name: Thieves' Tools
entries: You need thieves' tools to {@action Pick a Lock||Pick Locks} or {@action Disable a Device||Disable Devices} (of some types) using the {@skill Thievery} skill. If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with {@item replacement picks (generic)||replacement picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the {@action Repair} action. If you wear your thieves' tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

items: You need thieves' tools to {@action Pick a Lock||Pick Locks} or {@action Disable a Device||Disable Devices} (of some types) using the {@skill Thievery} skill. If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with {@item replacement picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the {@action Repair} action. If you wear your thieves' tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

entries: Infiltrator thieves' tools add a +1 item bonus to checks to {@action Pick a Lock||Pick Locks} and {@action Disable a Device||Disable Devices}.

items: You need thieves' tools to {@action Pick a Lock||Pick Locks} or {@action Disable a Device||Disable Devices} (of some types) using the {@skill Thievery} skill. If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with {@item infiltrator replacement picks||replacement picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the {@action Repair} action. If you wear your thieves' tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

entries: Smaller and made of stronger materials than most sets of thieves' tools, the items in this kit are much easier to conceal. You gain a +1 item bonus to {@skill Stealth} checks to {@action Conceal an Object||Conceal} these tools. They otherwise function as {@item infiltrator thieves' tools}.

items: You need thieves' tools to {@action Pick a Lock||Pick Locks} or {@action Disable a Device||Disable Devices} (of some types) using the {@skill Thievery} skill. If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with {@item concealable replacement picks|lopsg|replacement picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the {@action Repair} action. If you wear your thieves' tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

item.name: Third Eye
entries: When invested, this ornate crown and its incandescent gemstone meld into your head and take the form of a tattoo.

This grants you otherworldly sight and allows you to read auras. No one but you can manipulate the third eye while it's invested by you. Your heightened senses and ability to sense emotional auras grant you a +3 item bonus to {@skill Perception} checks.

You continuously see magic auras, as a 9thlevel {@spell detect magic} spell, except you see the location of all auras within 30 feet, not just the strongest. If you use a {@action Seek} action to study a creature you can see, you can perceive an aura that conveys knowledge of that creature's health, including all conditions and afflictions it has and an approximate percentage of its remaining Hit Points.
You gain the effects of an 8th-level {@spell true seeing} spell.

item.name: Thundering
entries: This weapon lets out a peal of thunder when it hits, dealing an extra {@damage 1d6} sonic damage on a successful {@action Strike}. On a critical hit, the target has to succeed at a DC 24 Fortitude save or be {@condition deafened} for 1 minute (or 1 hour on a critical failure).
The save DC is 34, and the deafness is permanent. Sonic damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target's sonic resistance.

item.name: Thunderstone
entries: When this stone hits a creature or a hard surface, it explodes with a deafening bang. A thunderstone deals the listed sonic damage and sonic splash damage, and each creature within 10 feet of the space in which the stone exploded must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw with the listed DC or be {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn. Many types of thunderstone grant an item bonus to attack rolls.
The bomb deals {@damage 1d4} sonic damage and 1 sonic splash damage, and the DC is 17.

entries.replace: the listed sonic damage and sonic splash damage
entries.with: {@damage 1d4} sonic damage and 1 sonic splash damage
DC 17 Fortitude saving throw

entries.replace: Many types of thunderstone grant an item bonus to attack rolls.

entries: You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals {@damage 2d4} sonic damage and 2 sonic splash damage, and the DC is 20.

entries.replace: the listed sonic damage and sonic splash damage
entries.with: {@damage 2d4} sonic damage and 2 sonic splash damage
DC 20 Fortitude saving throw

entries.replace: Many types of thunderstone grant an item bonus to attack rolls.
entries.with: You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

entries: You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals {@damage 3d4} sonic damage and 3 sonic splash damage, and the DC is 28.

entries.replace: the listed sonic damage and sonic splash damage
entries.with: {@damage 3d4} sonic damage and 3 sonic splash damage
DC 28 Fortitude saving throw

entries.replace: Many types of thunderstone grant an item bonus to attack rolls.
entries.with: You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls.

entries: You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals {@damage 4d4} sonic damage and 4 sonic splash damage, and the DC is 36.

entries.replace: the listed sonic damage and sonic splash damage
entries.with: {@damage 4d4} sonic damage and 4 sonic splash damage
DC 36 Fortitude saving throw

entries.replace: Many types of thunderstone grant an item bonus to attack rolls.
entries.with: You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls.

item.name: Thurible of Revelation
entries: This brass censer dangles on a length of chain.
Most thuribles of revelation are adorned with swirling Celestial text, though some are iron and feature Infernal or Abyssal text.

You light the incense inside the censer, and it burns for 1 hour. During that time, as long you are holding the thurible, you gain a +1 item bonus to {@skill Religion} checks, and any critical failure you roll when you {@action Decipher Writing} of a religious nature is a failure instead.

The thurible grants a +2 bonus. Once per day, when you activate the thurible, you can increase its revelations. During that activation, you can hold the thurible up to your eyes with an {@action Interact} action to gain the effects of see invisibility for 1 round by peering through the smoke.
The thurible grants a +3 bonus. The greater version shares the once-per-day enhanced revelations of the moderate version, except peering through the smoke also grants you the effects of true seeing.

item.name: Tiger Menuki

activate.trigger: You {@action Strike} with the affixed weapon.

entries: This tiger formed of pewter snarls viciously from your weapon's grip. When you activate the tiger, the affixed weapon gains the {@trait sweep} trait for the triggering attack and all other attacks for 1 minute.

item.name: Tindertwig
entries: An alchemical substance applied to one end of this tiny wooden stick ignites when struck against a rough surface. Creating a flame with a tindertwig is much faster than creating a flame with flint and steel. You can ignite the tindertwig and touch it to a flammable object as part of the same {@action Interact} action.

item.name: Tool
entries: This entry is a catchall for basic hand tools that don't have a specific adventuring purpose. A hoe, shovel, or sledgehammer is a long tool, and a hand drill, ice hook, or trowel is a short tool. A tool can usually be used as an improvised weapon, dealing {@damage 1d4} damage for a short tool or {@damage 1d6} for a long tool. The GM determines the damage type that's appropriate or adjusts the damage if needed.

item.name: Torch
entries: A torch sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 20 feet) for 1 hour. It can be used as an improvised weapon that deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage plus 1 fire damage.

item.name: Tracker's Goggles
entries: These lenses of forest-green glass are bound in rough leather stitched with crude twine. While wearing these goggles, you gain a +1 bonus to {@skill Survival} checks to {@action Sense Direction} and {@action Track}. If you fail a check to {@action Track}, you can try again after 30 minutes rather than an hour.
The goggles grant a +2 bonus. If you fail a check to {@action Track}, you can try again after 15 minutes rather than an hour.

item.name: Traveler's Any-tool
entries: Before it's activated, this item appears to be an ash rod capped with steel on either end.
You imagine a specific simple tool, and the any-tool transforms into it.

(Usually, you can choose from a tool listed in Chapter 6). This transforms the wooden portion into any haft and the metal caps into spades, hammer heads, or the like, allowing for most basic tools but nothing more complex. You can return the item to its rod form with an {@action Interact} action.

item.name: Trip Snare
entries: You set a cunning wire to trip a creature. A Medium or smaller creature that enters this snare's square must attempt a DC 20 Reflex save.

If you want to create a trip snare to trip a larger creature, you must create a group of contiguous snares of a length equal to the edge of that larger creature's space, and the creature must be moving such that it moves into the full set of snares.
For example, three trip snares in a 15-foot-line can trip a Huge creature coming down a corridor into the line of snares.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition flat-footed} until the start of its next turn.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature falls {@condition prone} and takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage.

item.name: Triton's Conch
entries: If you put this large opalescent conch shell to your ear, you can hear the sound of the roaring sea crashing against the shore.

You can raise the conch to your lips and blow into it, letting out a long, rumbling note. For the next minute, you and all allies who were within 30 feet of you when you activated the conch gain a +2 item bonus to {@skill Athletics} checks to {@action Swim} and can breathe under water.

item.name: Truesight Potion
entries: Upon drinking this clear, refreshing potion, you can see things as they actually are. You gain the benefits of a 7th-level {@spell true seeing} spell that has a counteract modifier of +25.

item.name: Truth Potion
entries: For 10 minutes after drinking this astringent potion, you can't intentionally lie and may be compelled to tell the truth.
Upon drinking the potion, attempt a DC 19 Will save. You can voluntarily fail or critically fail.

entries.Success: The potion does not affect you.
entries.Failure: When you speak, you must tell the truth.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, and when someone asks you a question, you must attempt another DC 19 Will saving throw. If you fail this saving throw, you must answer the question truthfully if you are able to do so; if you succeed, you are temporarily immune to further attempts to ask the same question within the potion's duration.

item.name: Twining Staff
entries: Appearing to be just a small, flat disc made of twigs, this item can grow and shrink.

You cause the twigs to rapidly grow or contract, reshaping into a +1 striking staff, a +1 striking bo staff, or its disc form. In its disc form, it has negligible Bulk and must be held in one hand to be activated. In the other forms, it has the same Bulk as a normal weapon of its type. You can switch your grip as part of the activation.

When you expand the item, you can use the force of the expansion to {@action High Jump} or to try to {@action Force Open} a door or the like by wedging the disc into a gap before activation. The staff makes the {@skill Athletics} check with a +15 modifier.

item.name: Unholy
item.usage: etched onto a weapon without a holy rune
entries: An unholy rune instills fiendish power into the etched weapon.
A weapon with this rune deals an additional {@damage 1d6} evil damage when it hits a good target. If you are good, you are {@condition enfeebled 2} while carrying or wielding this weapon.

entries.trigger: You critically succeed at an attack roll against a good creature with the weapon
entries: The target takes {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} equal to {@dice 1d8} per weapon damage die of the etched weapon.

item.craftReq: You are evil.

item.name: Unholy Water
entries: An evil deity's malice lies within this vial of water. You activate a vial of unholy water by throwing it as a {@action Strike}. It's a simple thrown weapon with a range increment of 20 feet. Unlike an alchemical bomb, it doesn't add the {@trait manipulate} trait to the attack made with it.
Unholy water deals {@damage 1d6} evil damage and 1 evil splash damage.
It damages only celestials and creatures that have a weakness to evil damage.

item.name: Vanishing Coin

activate.requirements: You are a master in {@skill Stealth}.
activate.trigger: You attempt a {@skill Stealth} check for initiative, but you haven't rolled yet

entries: This copper coin dangles from a leather strip strung through a hole drilled in the center. Until activated, the coin becomes {@condition invisible} for a few seconds at random intervals every few minutes. When you activate the coin, it casts a 2nd-level {@spell invisibility} spell on you, lasting until the end of your next turn.

item.name: Ventriloquist's Ring
entries: This elegant copper ring has miniature images of songbirds engraved around its circumference. You gain a +1 item bonus to {@skill Deception} checks.
Twisting the ring around your finger allows you to magically throw your voice, with the effects of a {@spell ventriloquism} spell (DC 19).
Twisting the ring around your finger allows you to magically throw your voice, with the effects of a 2nd-level {@spell ventriloquism} (DC 27).
The ring grants a +2 bonus. When you activate the ring, you gain the effects of 2nd-level {@spell ventriloquism} (DC 27). You can activate the ring any number of times per day.

item.name: Verdant Staff
entries: This oak branch grows leaves in spring that change color in autumn and shed in winter. While wielding it, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Nature} checks to identify plants.
You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craftReq: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

items: {@bold 2nd} barkskin, entangle, shape wood, tree shape

item.name: Vine Arrow
entries: Leafy stalks protrude from the shaft of this rustic arrow. When an activated vine arrow hits a target, the arrow's shaft splits and grows, wrapping the target in vines. The target takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for {@dice 2d4} rounds, or until it {@action Escape||Escapes} against a DC of 19. On a critical hit, the target is also {@condition immobilized} until it {@action Escape||Escapes}.

item.name: Viper Arrow
entries: The shaft of this arrow is covered in fine green scales, and its iron head comes to a pair of points almost like fangs. After an activated viper arrow hits a target, the arrow transforms into a {@creature viper}. The target is affected by the viper's poison, as if it had been bitten. The viper then lands in an open space adjacent to the target.

The viper has the summoned trait and acts at the end of your turn, even though you didn't use the {@action Sustain a Spell} action. It is under the GM's control, but it generally attacks the creature the arrow struck. The viper vanishes after 1 minute or when slain.
item.craftReq: Supply one casting of {@spell summon animal}.

item.name: Viper's Fang

activate.trigger: A creature within your reach uses a {@trait manipulate} or {@trait move} action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

entries: You are a master with the affixed weapon.
When you activate this resin-strengthened viper skull, you make an {@action Attack of Opportunity} against the triggering creature.
If you have {@action Attack of Opportunity}, you can activate the viper's fang as a free action.

item.name: Vorpal
item.usage: etched onto a slashing melee weapon
entries: Originally created as a means of slaying the legendary jabberwock, vorpal weapons prove equally effective against nearly any foe with a head.

entries.trigger: You roll a natural 20 on a {@action Strike} with the weapon, critically succeed, and deal slashing damage.
entries: The target must succeed at a DC 37 Fortitude save or be decapitated. This kills any creature except ones that don't require a head to live. For creatures with multiple heads, this usually kills the creature only if you sever its last head.

item.name: Voyager's Pack
entries: This leather rucksack has icons burned into it, and every time it's taken to a plane it hasn't been to before, a new icon representing that plane scorches into the surface. The pack grants you a +3 bonus to {@skill Survival} checks.

It also enables you to see the magical traces of creatures' passage, allowing you to {@action Track} a creature that has teleported. The GM sets the DC of this check, usually using the level and DC of the teleportation spell. This lets you find the location of the creature's destination, and you can use that destination when casting teleport or activating the pack, even though you don't know what it looks like.

The pack contains an extradimensional space with the same properties as a {@item bag of holding (type II)||type II bag of holding}. This space contains the contents of a climber's kit. If any components of that kit are removed and not returned, they return to the pack at dawn each day.

As you activate the pack, you can harness up to four willing creatures to the ropes on the pack. At the end of the activation time, the pack casts a 7th-level {@spell plane shift} or {@spell teleport} spell, transporting you and everyone attached to the pack. Attempt a DC 45 {@skill Survival} check. On a success, you arrive 25 miles off target using plane shift or halve the distance you're off-target with teleport. On a critical success, you arrive exactly on target.

item.name: Wand of Continuation
entries: This wand increases a spell's duration. Yellow embers spiral over its surface until the spell ends.

entries.note: the activation takes {@as 2} if the spell normally takes {@as 1} to cast, or {@as 3} if the spell normally takes {@as 2}
entries: You {@action Cast a Spell||Cast the Spell}, and its duration is increased by half.

item.craftReq: Supply a casting of a spell of the appropriate level. The spell must have a casting time of {@as 1} or {@as 2} and a duration no less than 10 minutes and no greater than 1 hour.

item.name: Wand of Manifold Missiles
entries: This wand features a carved dragon's head at its top and a polished metal sphere set in its midsection.

You cast {@spell magic missile} of the indicated level. After you cast the spell, an additional missile or missiles are released from the wand at the start of each of your turns, as though you cast the 1-action version of {@spell magic missile}. Choose targets each time. This lasts for 1 minute, until you're no longer wielding the wand, or until you try to activate the wand again.

item.craftReq: Supply a casting of {@spell magic missile} of the appropriate level.

item.name: Wand of Slaying
entries: This polished black wand has a green gem at the tip, and anyone who looks into it sees a reflection of a grinning skull instead of their face.

You cast {@spell finger of death} of the indicated level. If the spell slays its target, the corpse releases negative energy in a 20-foot emanation, dealing negative damage equal to double the spell's level.

item.craftReq: Supply a casting of finger of death of the appropriate level.

item.name: Wand of Smoldering Fireballs
entries: This blackened, heavily burned stick smells faintly of bat guano.
You cast {@spell fireball} of the indicated level. Each creature that fails its save takes {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage}.

item.craftReq: Supply a casting of fireball of the appropriate level.

entries: {@condition persistent damage} {@damage 1d6}.

entries.with: {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage}

entries: {@condition persistent damage} {@damage 2d6}.

entries.with: {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage}

entries: {@condition persistent damage} {@damage 3d6}.

entries.with: {@damage 3d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage}

entries: {@condition persistent damage} {@damage 4d6}.

entries.with: {@damage 4d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage}

item.name: Wand of Widening
entries: The end of this wand is forked instead of tapered.

entries.note: this activation takes {@as 2} if the spell normally takes {@as 1} to cast, or {@as 3} if the spell normally takes {@as 2}
entries: You {@action Cast a Spell||Cast the Spell}, and increase its area. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet; add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller; or add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

item.craftReq: Supply a casting of a spell of the appropriate level. The spell must have a casting time of {@as 1} or {@as 2}, can't have a duration, and must have an area of burst (10 feet or more), cone, or line.

item.name: Warning Snare
entries: Using materials specific to the area, you connect a sound-making component to a trip wire or a pressure plate.

This snare is like an {@item alarm snare}, but its subtle sound blends into ambient noise. You can detect this sound as long as you're within 1,000 feet of the snare and aren't prevented from hearing it. Other creatures in that area who are searching might notice the sound if their {@skill Perception} check result meets or exceeds your Craft DC.

item.name: Waterskin
entries: When it's full, a waterskin contains roughly 1 day's worth of water for a Small or Medium creature.

item.name: Wayfinder
entries: This compact compass repurposes ancient technology to draw fantastic powers from the mysterious magical items called aeon stones. It serves as a badge of office for agents of the Pathfinder Society and as a status symbol among adventurers of any stripe. A wayfinder functions as a compass.

An indentation in the middle of the wayfinder can hold a single {@item aeon stone|Crb}. Placing an aeon stone in this indentation provides you all the benefits of having the aeon stone orbiting your head, but it protects the stone from being noticed or stolen as easily. You invest a wayfinder and the aeon stone within it simultaneously, and they count as only one item toward your investiture limit. An invested aeon stone slotted in a wayfinder also grants its resonant power.

If you have more than one wayfinder with an invested aeon stone on your person at a given time, destructive interference from their resonance prevents you from gaining benefits from any of them. You can still benefit from additional aeon stones orbiting your head, just not in wayfinders.
The wayfinder is targeted by a 1st-level {@spell light} spell.

item.name: Weapon Potency
entries: Magical enhancements make this weapon strike true. Attack rolls with this weapon gain a +1 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with one property rune.

You can upgrade the weapon potency rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.

variants.craftReq: You are an expert in {@skill Crafting}.

entries.with: +1 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with one property rune.

variants.craftReq: You are a master in {@skill Crafting}.
entries: The item bonus to attack rolls is +2, and the weapon can be etched with two property runes.

entries.with: +2 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with two property runes.

variants.craftReq: You are legendary in {@skill Crafting}.
entries: The item bonus to attack rolls is +3, and the weapon can be etched with three property runes.

entries.replace: \+1 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with one property rune\.
entries.with: +3 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with three property runes.

entries.replace: You can upgrade the weapon potency rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.

entries: The item bonus to attack rolls is +4, and the weapon can be etched with three property runes.

{@note This version of the potency rune has been added by PF2eTools. This rune is not available for purchase or {@action Crafting} through mundane means. It only exists on Unique and/or Artifact weaponry, such as {@item Axe Of The Dwarven Lords|GMG} or {@item Serithtial|GMG}.}

entries.replace: \+1 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with one property rune\.

item.name: Whisper of the First Lie
entries: This delicate necklace contains bottled whispers distilled from a source on the Astral Plane rumored to be connected to the first lie ever told.

While wearing the necklace, you gain a +3 item bonus to {@skill Deception} checks, and you can attempt to counteract effects that would force you to tell the truth or determine whether you are lying. Success on this counteract attempt lets you ignore the effect, rather than removing the effect entirely. The counteract level is 9, with a counteract modifier of +35.
You unstopper the vial and release the lie, creating the effect of a fabricated truth (DC 47). The vial is emptied and can never be activated again.

item.craftReq: Supply a casting of fabricated truth.

item.name: Winged Boots
entries: Made from soft leather, with delicate white wings attached to the heel, these boots are ensorcelled with powerful air magic. Whenever you fall while wearing these boots, the boots automatically cast {@spell feather fall} on you. This benefit can't trigger again for 10 minutes.
You speak a command word and click the boots' heels together to cause the wings to animate and flap rapidly, granting you a fly Speed of 30 feet for 10 minutes.

item.name: Winter Wolf Elixir
entries: This elixir warms your core and improves your circulation. For 24 hours, you are protected from the effects of severe cold.
You're also protected from extreme cold.
You're also protected from extreme and incredible cold.

item.name: Wolf Fang

activate.trigger: You successfully {@action Trip} a foe
activate.requirements: You are trained in {@skill Athletics}.

entries: This wolf canine is bound in a strip of leather and tied to a buckle or strap of a suit of armor. When you activate the fang, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier to the target of your {@action Trip}. If your {@action Trip} would already deal physical damage that doesn't include an ability modifier, add your Strength modifier to that damage.

item.name: Wolfsbane
entries: Wolfsbane appears in folklore for its link to werecreatures.
If you are afflicted with lycanthropy and survive stage 3 of wolfsbane, you're immediately cured of the lycanthropy.

item.name: Wondrous Figurine
entries: Each one of these statuettes is 1 inch in height, carved from a specific material and taking the shape of a particular animal or animals.

You activate the statue by placing it on solid ground and then speaking its name, causing the statuette to transform into a living creature or creatures. In creature form, the figurine has the minion trait. It can understand your language and it obeys you to the best of its ability when you use an action to command it. The specifics of each creature, as well as the activation's frequency (if any), appear in its entry below.

If the figurine is slain while in animal form, it reverts to its statue shape and cannot be activated again until 1 week has passed. If the figurine is destroyed in statue form, it is shattered and its magic is lost.

This statuette depicts a pair of gold lions, and when activated, it becomes a pair of adult {@creature lion||lions}. The lions can be called on only once per day, and they remain in lion form for no more than 1 hour. If either of the lions is slain, that lion cannot be summoned again until 1 week has passed, but this doesn't prevent you from summoning the other.

This tiny statue first appears to be a formless lump of jade until closer inspection reveals it to be a serpentine body curled into a snug knot. When activated, this figurine becomes a {@creature giant viper}. The figurine can be used only once per day, and it can remain in serpent form for no more than 10 minutes.

Finely carved from a solid piece of marble, this gleaming elephant statuette becomes a fully grown {@creature elephant} when activated. The elephant can be called upon no more than four times per month.

It remains for 24 hours as long as it is being used as a beast of burden or for transport. If it attempts an attack or otherwise engages in combat, it reverts to statuette form after {@dice 1d4} rounds.

This sinister-looking black statuette resembles a horse rearing up on its hind legs. When activated, this figurine becomes a {@creature nightmare}. It can be called upon once per week for up to 24 hours, though it won't use plane shift or its other abilities on behalf of its rider. Although evil, it allows itself to be ridden by creatures of any alignment, although if a good creature mounts it, the rider must attempt a DC {@flatDC 3} flat check. On a failure, the nightmare uses plane shift to take the rider to a random location in the Abyss, where it promptly returns to statue form, stranding its rider in that nightmarish place.
This simple onyx statue transforms into a {@creature guard dog}. The dog has a +4 circumstance bonus to {@skill Survival} checks to {@action Track}, and it has {@ability darkvision}.

When the dog senses a {@condition hidden} creature with its scent, that creature is instead {@condition observed} and {@condition concealed}. The onyx dog can be activated once per week and remains in its form for up to 6 hours.

item.name: Wounding
item.usage: etched onto a piercing or slashing melee weapon
entries: Weapons with wounding runes are said to thirst for blood.

When you hit a creature with a wounding weapon, you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}. On a critical hit, it instead deals {@damage 1d12} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}.

item.name: Writing Set
entries: Using a writing set, you can draft correspondence and scribe scrolls. A set includes stationery, including a variety of paper and parchment, as well as ink, a quill or inkpen, sealing wax, and a simple seal. If you've written a large amount, you can refill your kit with {@item extra ink and paper}.

item.name: Wyvern Poison
entries: Properly harvested and preserved, the poison from a wyvern's sting is effective and direct.
